alert.note: Alert for Stone (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 03 at 3:00PM CST until February 08 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, George, Greene, Perry and Stone. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 259 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wiggins, Lucedale, Leakesville, Perkinston, McHenry, McLain, Benndale, Avent, Deep Creek, Leaf, Dale, Merrill, Crossroads, Progress, Bexley, Barbara, Ramsey Springs, Oak Grove, Little Creek and Whites Crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
